verb.description: Decide or announce that (a planned event) will not take place.
examples: he was forced to cancel his visit

verb.description: (of a factor or circumstance) neutralize or negate the force or effect of (another)
examples: the electric fields may cancel each other out

noun.description: A mark made on a postage stamp to show that it has been used.
A new page or section inserted in a book to replace the original text, typically to correct an error.

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense obliterate or delete writing by drawing or stamping lines across it): from Old French canceller, from Latin cancellare, from cancelli crossbars.
